mods:mods.note: Horace "Mike" Koepke (later Albany Fire Chief) and Rich Courtney receive a citation from unidentified Berkeley Humane Society representative after their heroic rescue of Snoopy, the dog in Mike's arms, following a disastrous home fire on Peralta during the holidays of 1968. After carrying out three children, assisting a fourth child and the unconscious mother, they went back for Snoopy, who was unconscious under the bed. They gave him oxygen. "Nobody said much about the people we rescued," Mike said.
Donated to the Albany Historical Society 2/12/85, by Albany Fire Department.

mods:mods.note: Westbrae Red train stopped on a spur. Handwriting on verso: "Key system 271 'Westbrae Dinkey.' Car now at Rio Vista Trolley Museum. July 13, 1941. Abandoned July 25, 1941. This line served Albany riders from the intersection of Santa Fe Avenue and Key Route Boulevard, which was the location of this station. It actually did not enter Albany, the car being in Berkeley and I am standing in Albany. A duplex 1219 and 1221 Santa Fe Avenue, now occupies this station. Santa Fe R.R. at right. Louis Bradas."
Donated to the Albany Historical Society by Louis Bradas.

mods:mods.note: Albany Historian Catherine Webb, nee Catherine Janes, was born in Nevada City on August 23, 1905. In July 1908, her family moved to Durango, Mexico, where they lived until their return to Nevada City in late 1911. This photograph was taken in Mexico when she was five years old, and was mounted inside her 65th birthday invitation.

mods:mods.note: Handwriting on verso: "The second (?) building for First Baptist Church of Albany was near Albany High School. The service started on Sept. 6, 1908 in the home of Mrs. A. Hiney. The First B. C. of Albany was build [sic] in 1908."

Note on Church history: The second location of the First Baptist Church was where the Albany Pool is now. [i.e. Portland east of Key Route Blvd.] The School Board owned property at Solano & Pomona. They exchanged this property for the First Baptist Church property on Portland in 1948 and built the Albany Pool. The First Baptist Church built their existing church at Solano and Pomona.
Donated to the Albany Historical Society 9/15/83, by Dorothy Boyd.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Francis Olson Winfield, 4th of July Queen.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: [front l to rt] Mrs. John Glavinovich -- Mrs. Joe Thelen -- Mrs. Earl Vaughan -- [rear l to rt] Mrs. Dyer -- Mrs. John Paul -- unknown --Miss Lindquist -- Queen Francis [Olson Winfield]-- Maisie Wixson -- unknown -- Mrs. Jack Mattos -- Freda Brown.

Ceremony for Albany 4th of July Queen Francis Olson (Mrs. Ray Winfield). Twelve women seated in two rows on risers, backed by draped American flags as bunting. Queen is back-row center, seated on highest riser wearing tiara and faux-ermine cape.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Albany firemen save dog.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Horace "Mike" Koepke (later Albany Fire Chief) and Rich Courtney receive a citation from unidentified Berkeley Humane Society representative after their heroic rescue of Snoopy, the dog in Mike's arms, following a disastrous home fire on Peralta during the holidays of 1968. After carrying out three children, assisting a fourth child and the unconscious mother, they went back for Snoopy, who was unconscious under the bed. They gave him oxygen. "Nobody said much about the people we rescued," Mike said.
Donated to the Albany Historical Society 2/12/85, by Albany Fire Department.

Donated to the Albany Historical Society 10/26/83, by Richard McSheehy.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Westbrae Red train.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Westbrae Red train stopped on a spur. Handwriting on verso: "Key system 271 'Westbrae Dinkey.' Car now at Rio Vista Trolley Museum. July 13, 1941. Abandoned July 25, 1941. This line served Albany riders from the intersection of Santa Fe Avenue and Key Route Boulevard, which was the location of this station. It actually did not enter Albany, the car being in Berkeley and I am standing in Albany. A duplex 1219 and 1221 Santa Fe Avenue, now occupies this station. Santa Fe R.R. at right. Louis Bradas."
Donated to the Albany Historical Society by Louis Bradas.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Catherine Janes Webb.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Albany Historian Catherine Webb, nee Catherine Janes, was born in Nevada City on August 23, 1905. In July 1908, her family moved to Durango, Mexico, where they lived until their return to Nevada City in late 1911. This photograph was taken in Mexico when she was five years old, and was mounted inside her 65th birthday invitation.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First Baptist Church.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwriting on verso: "The second (?) building for First Baptist Church of Albany was near Albany High School. The service started on Sept. 6, 1908 in the home of Mrs. A. Hiney. The First B. C. of Albany was build [sic] in 1908."

Note on Church history: The second location of the First Baptist Church was where the Albany Pool is now. [i.e. Portland east of Key Route Blvd.] The School Board owned property at Solano & Pomona. They exchanged this property for the First Baptist Church property on Portland in 1948 and built the Albany Pool. The First Baptist Church built their existing church at Solano and Pomona.
Donated to the Albany Historical Society 9/15/83, by Dorothy Boyd.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First School in Albany -- Miller's Barn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: [Front row l-rt] Eleanor Bergsen -- Loretta Galvin -- Laura Sedobeer -- Wanda Ballard -- Genevive Beck -- Christie Hageman -- [Second row] Bergeson -- Lucille Plaehn -- Alma Steiglitz -- Esther Carlson -- Anita Kruger -- Oscar Carlson -- unknown -- Edward Zapiski -- [Third row] Tony Lindquist -- Olga Lindstrom -- unknown -- Marie Lindstrom -- Anderson -- Eleanor Lindquist -- unknown -- Rocco -- [Fourth row] Unknown -- Mary Ramsey -- Laura Perry -- Marie ? -- Ralph Phaen -- Gilbert Neilson -- Smoth -- Raymond Higuerra -- Charles Zapiski [Last row] Lillian Lindquist -- Annie Ambronesko -- James Grifin.

Text beneath photo: "First School in Albany, Calif. Compliments of J. Karst." Handwriting on verso: "First school house in Albany was in 1908 when Farmer Miller's barn was used. Taken at Miller's Barn. First constable (?) Miller." Handwritten note affixed to verso: "Miller's Barn - First Albany School [followed by list of names]"
Oval-shaped image within rectangle, on rectangular paper, 29 x 26 cm. Alternate version: People 111 (b&w)
Donated to the Albany Historical Society 8/13/82, by J. Karst.
